name: affirmations/en
text:
Find a comfortable position, either sitting or lying down. Close your eyes gently, and take a deep breath in through your nose, filling your lungs completely. Hold that breath for a moment, and then exhale slowly through your mouth, letting go of any tension you might be holding.

<PAUSE: 5> 

Bring your attention to your breath, noticing the natural rhythm of inhalation and exhalation. Allow your breath to be a gentle guide, slowly bringing you into a deeper state of relaxation.

<PAUSE: 10>

Now, start by repeating silently or aloud, "I am calm." Feel the words resonate within you, sinking deep into your being with every repetition. "I am calm."

<PAUSE: 15> 

Let this affirmation wash over you like a soothing wave, calming your mind, body, and spirit. "I am calm."

<PAUSE: 15>

Next, shift your focus to the affirmation, "I am strong." Say it to yourself with conviction. "I am strong." Feel the strength within you, like an unyielding force, steady and powerful.

<PAUSE: 20> 

Allow this strength to permeate every cell in your body, solidifying your sense of inner power. "I am strong."

<PAUSE: 20>

Now, gently bring your awareness to the affirmation, "I am at peace." Repeat these words softly, like a comforting embrace. "I am at peace." 

<PAUSE: 15> 

Feel a deep sense of serenity and tranquility filling your entire being. "I am at peace."

<PAUSE: 15> 

Continue to breathe naturally, allowing these affirmations to harmonize together within you. "I am calm. I am strong. I am at peace."

<PAUSE: 30> 

Notice how each affirming statement is enhancing your sense of well-being, grounding you in the present moment.

<PAUSE: 20> 

As you prepare to end this meditation, take one last deep breath in, hold it briefly, and exhale fully. 

<PAUSE: 10>

Gently wiggle your fingers and toes, bringing some movement back into your body. 

<PAUSE: 5> 

When you feel ready, gradually open your eyes and take a moment to appreciate this sense of calm, strength, and peace that you have cultivated. 

<PAUSE: 10>
